oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1956-04-28 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 28, 1956. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ray Price (host/performer) with Van Howard, guest performer Charline Arthur, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Dale Potter, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Grandpa Jones. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ray Price; Rod Brasfield; Charline Arthur; Tommy Jackson; Dale Potter; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ray Price -- You Done Me Wrong (Ray Price) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Charline Arthur -- Kiss The Baby Goodnight (Charline Arthur) -- Ray Price introduces Tommy Jackson and Dale Potter -- Mississippi Sawyer (Tommy Jackson fiddle, Dale Potter fiddle) -- Ray Price talks -- The Old Rugged Cross (Ray Price) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Ray Price) -- Prince Albert jingle (Ray Price) -- Ray Price introduces Del Wood -- Ain't She Sweet (Del Wood)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Hay, George D. (George Dewey), 1895-1968; Brasfield, Rod; Minnie Pearl; Wood, Del; Jones, Grandpa, 1913-1998; Jackson, Tommy; Howard, Van; Potter, Dale; Price, Ray, 1926-2013; Arthur, Charline
